In Greek mythology, Styx is a deity and a river that forms the boundary between 
Earth and the Underworld (the domain often called Hades, which also is the 
name of its ruler). The rivers Styx, Phlegethon, Acheron, Lethe, and Cocytus all 
converge at the ... The deities were bound by the Styx and swore oaths upon Styx
